intro: Gossypium nankin, commonly known as Chinese cotton, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, fluffy fibers that are used in textile production. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces capsules that contain the cotton fibers. Gossypium nankin is valued for its historical significance in the development of cotton cultivation in Asia.
